text: Admire is a city in Lyon County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 130 people lived there. ==History== Admire was created in 1886. It was named after one of its creators, Jacob Admire. The first post office in Admire was created in November 1886. Admire was a station and shipping point on the Missouri Pacific Railroad. By the mid 1990s, rail service in Admire had been ended, and the tracks are now being used as a rail trail. ==Geography== Admire is at (38.640995, -96.102009). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==People== Admire is part of the Emporia Micropolitan Statistical Area. ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 130 people, 48 households, and 38 families living in Admire. Of the households, 83.3% owned their home and 16.7% rented their home. The median age was 39.5. Of the people, 95.4% were White and 3.1% were Native American. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 10.8% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 156 people, 60 households, and 43 families living in Admire. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * City of Admire * Admire - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 251, local school district ;Maps * Admire City Map, KDOT Category:Cities in Lyon County, Kansas Category:1886 establishments in Kansas
title: Admire, Kansas
